title: Rights of Allah
introduction: Allah has rights over us as our Creator, Sustainer, and the One to whom we will all return. Fulfilling these rights is the heart of true faith and the purpose of our existence. Recognizing and honoring Allah’s rights brings peace, purpose, and closeness to Him in this life and everlasting success in the next.

sections.heading: Worship Alone
sections.content: The greatest right of Allah is that we worship Him alone, without partners, intermediaries, or equals. This is the meaning of Tawheed — the oneness of Allah — which is the foundation of Islam. We must direct all acts of worship, such as prayer, dua, sacrifice, and hope, only to Him. Associating others with Him (shirk) is the greatest injustice and the one sin that, if not repented from, is not forgiven. Sincerely living by 'La ilaha illallah' — there is no god worthy of worship except Allah — frees the heart from dependence on anything else.

sections.heading: Obedience and Gratitude
sections.content: Another right of Allah is that we obey His commands and stay away from what He has forbidden. His guidance protects us from harm and leads us to what is best for us in this world and the Hereafter. Gratitude is also part of fulfilling His rights. Allah’s blessings are countless — our health, wealth, families, and every moment of life are gifts from Him. True gratitude means thanking Him with our hearts, praising Him with our tongues, and using His blessings in ways that please Him.

sections.heading: Trust and Reliance
sections.content: Placing our full trust and reliance (tawakkul) on Allah is another right He deserves. We turn to Him in every situation — in ease and hardship — knowing that He alone controls all affairs. While we take practical steps in life, our hearts should depend completely on Him. When we seek His help through sincere dua and patience, He grants us what is best, sometimes in ways we do not expect. Trusting Allah brings peace to the heart and frees us from unnecessary worry and fear.

conclusion: Fulfilling Allah’s rights is what gives life its true purpose and brings tranquility to the soul. By worshipping Him alone, obeying Him sincerely, being grateful, and relying fully on Him, we strengthen our faith and earn His pleasure. May Allah help us fulfill His rights as He deserves and keep us firm upon His path.
